definitions.definition: The action of pretending ; false or simulated show or appearance; false or hypocritical assertion or representation.
examples: He visited the king under the pretense of friendliness.
"Lady Little", the title that she used, was just a pretense .
She appeared to weep uncontrollably, but it was all pretense .
She was a plain-speaking woman without a hint of pretense .

definitions.definition: Intention or purpose not real but professed.
An unsupported claim made or implied.
An insincere attempt to reach a specific condition or quality.

main_definition: ( countable or uncountable ) The action of pretending ; false or simulated show or appearance; false or hypocritical assertion or representation.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Affectation or ostentation of manner.
Intention or purpose not real but professed.
An unsupported claim made or implied.
An insincere attempt to reach a specific condition or quality.
